title: Matthew Chapter 12 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 12 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 12 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 12.

questions.question: What were Jesus' disciples doing when Jesus went through the corn on the sabbath day?
options: Plucking ears of corn to eat
Praying silently
Gathering stones
Singing hymns
questions.correctAnswer: Plucking ears of corn to eat
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:1 states that Jesus' disciples were hungry and began to pluck ears of corn and eat them.

questions.question: Who questioned Jesus about the lawfulness of his disciples' actions on the sabbath?
options: Pharisees
Sadducees
Roman soldiers
Disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Pharisees
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:2 mentions that the Pharisees saw the disciples plucking corn on the sabbath and said it was unlawful.

questions.question: According to Jesus, who ate the shewbread when he was hungry?
options: David and those with him
The priests only
The Pharisees
The disciples
questions.correctAnswer: David and those with him
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:3-4 explains that David ate the shewbread when he was hungry, even though it was lawful only for the priests to eat it.

questions.question: Who is described as 'Lord even of the sabbath day'?
options: The Son of man
Moses
David
The High Priest
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:8 states that the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.

questions.question: What did Jesus do to the man with the withered hand?
options: He healed him by stretching forth his hand
He told him to rest
He sent him away
He prayed for him silently
questions.correctAnswer: He healed him by stretching forth his hand
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:13 says Jesus told the man to stretch forth his hand, and it was restored whole.

questions.question: What did the Pharisees plan to do after Jesus healed on the sabbath?
options: Destroy him
Praise him
Follow him
Report him to Pilate
questions.correctAnswer: Destroy him
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:14 states the Pharisees held a council against Jesus to figure out how to destroy him.

questions.question: What did Jesus say was lawful to do on the sabbath?
options: To do well
To rest completely
To fast
To avoid all work
questions.correctAnswer: To do well
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:12 explains that it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days, as illustrated by rescuing a sheep.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say is greater than the temple?
options: He himself
David
The High Priest
The Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: He himself
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:6 states that in that place is one greater than the temple, referring to Jesus.

questions.question: Who did the people say Jesus was after he healed the demon-possessed man who was blind and mute?
options: The son of David
A prophet
A teacher
A Pharisee
questions.correctAnswer: The son of David
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:23 shows the people were amazed and asked if Jesus was not the son of David.

questions.question: What did the Pharisees accuse Jesus of using to cast out devils?
options: Beelzebub, prince of the devils
The Spirit of God
Sorcery
His own power
questions.correctAnswer: Beelzebub, prince of the devils
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:24 records Pharisees saying Jesus cast out devils by Beelzebub.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that every kingdom divided against itself will stand strong.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:25 says every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation and will not stand.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost will not be forgiven.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:31 states that blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that speaking against the Son of man will never be forgiven.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:32 states that speaking against the Son of man shall be forgiven, but speaking against the Holy Ghost will not be forgiven.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'For by thy words thou shalt be ______, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.'
options: justified
blessed
saved
punished
questions.correctAnswer: justified
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:37 says by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

questions.question: What sign did Jesus say would be given to the evil and adulterous generation?
options: The sign of the prophet Jonas
A sign from heaven
A miracle of healing
A thunderstorm
questions.correctAnswer: The sign of the prophet Jonas
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:39 says no sign will be given except the sign of the prophet Jonas.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 12 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 12 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with legalism about Sabbath rules and feels condemned for small actions. Based on Matthew 12, what biblical truth would you share about mercy and obedience?
options: Mercy is more important than sacrifice and Sabbath laws are made to serve man, not to be a burden.
Strictly following Sabbath laws is the only way to please God.
Only priests are allowed to break Sabbath rules.
Avoid all work on the Sabbath at any cost.
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy is more important than sacrifice and Sabbath laws are made to serve man, not to be a burden.
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in Matthew 12:7 that mercy is preferred over sacrifice and he reminds that the Sabbath was made for man's benefit, not to bring condemnation (Matthew 12:1-8).

questions.question: How does Matthew 12 teach us about trusting Jesus' authority over religious traditions when a believer questions Sabbath practices?
options: Jesus, as Lord of the Sabbath, has authority to interpret the law rightly.
All traditions must be followed without question.
Only the Pharisees can interpret the law.
Sabbath rules are more important than mercy.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus, as Lord of the Sabbath, has authority to interpret the law rightly.
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:8 states that the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath, showing Jesus' divine authority over religious laws and traditions.

questions.question: A believer is hesitant to help others on their day off, fearing it might break religious rules. What principle from Matthew 12 encourages doing good on the Sabbath?
options: It is lawful to do good and save life on the Sabbath, as a man is more valuable than a sheep.
No work or help is allowed on the Sabbath.
Only priests may perform acts of kindness on the Sabbath.
Helping others should wait until after the Sabbath.
questions.correctAnswer: It is lawful to do good and save life on the Sabbath, as a man is more valuable than a sheep.
questions.explanation: Jesus explains in Matthew 12:11-12 that rescuing a sheep on the Sabbath is done and, therefore, doing good for people on the Sabbath is lawful.

questions.question: When facing opposition for serving others, what does Matthew 12 teach about perseverance and trusting God's timing?
options: Jesus withdrew from hostility but continued healing and helping many.
Stop serving when opposition arises.
Only serve when praised by others.
Ignore the needs of others to avoid conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus withdrew from hostility but continued healing and helping many.
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:14-15, Jesus withdrew when threatened but still healed all who followed him, modeling wise perseverance balanced with compassion.

questions.question: What does Matthew 12 teach about humility and the source of true wisdom when people demand signs or proof?
options: A humble heart trusts God’s word rather than demanding signs.
Signs must be demanded to believe.
Wisdom comes from worldly knowledge.
Only the strongest show faith without signs.
questions.correctAnswer: A humble heart trusts God’s word rather than demanding signs.
questions.explanation: Jesus rebukes the demand for signs in Matthew 12:38-39, emphasizing faith over spectacle and pointing to the sign of Jonah as a greater testimony.

questions.question: How does Matthew 12 emphasize the importance of the words we speak and their impact on our spiritual life?
options: Every idle word spoken will be accounted for at judgment.
Words have no real spiritual consequence.
Only actions matter, not words.
Speaking harshly is acceptable if the intention is good.
questions.correctAnswer: Every idle word spoken will be accounted for at judgment.
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:36-37 teaches that words reveal the heart and have eternal consequences, urging careful speech and integrity.

questions.question: A believer struggles with anger and harsh words. According to Matthew 12, what biblical principle can help them change their speech and character?
options: Good words come from a good heart and an evil heart produces evil words.
Words do not reflect the heart.
Anger is a sign of strength.
Changing speech is unnecessary if intentions are pure.
questions.correctAnswer: Good words come from a good heart and an evil heart produces evil words.
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:34-35 explains that the mouth speaks from the abundance of the heart, so transforming the heart changes speech and behavior.

questions.question: What does Matthew 12 teach about forgiveness and the seriousness of blasphemy against the Holy Spirit?
options: All sins and blasphemies can be forgiven except blasphemy against the Holy Ghost.
No sins are unforgivable.
Blasphemy against the Son of Man is unforgivable.
Forgiveness is only for those who never sin.
questions.correctAnswer: All sins and blasphemies can be forgiven except blasphemy against the Holy Ghost.
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:31-32 states clearly that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit is an unforgivable sin, highlighting the gravity of rejecting God’s Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 12, Jesus taught that those who do the will of God are considered His true family.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:49-50, Jesus defines his true family as those who do the will of His Father, emphasizing obedience and spiritual kinship.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 12 teaches that Jesus used Beelzebub's power to cast out demons.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus denies this accusation in Matthew 12:24-28, explaining that His power to cast out demons comes from the Spirit of God, not Beelzebub.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Matthew 12 teaches that a person is known by their _____, just as a tree is known by its fruit.
options: actions
words
thoughts
fruit
questions.correctAnswer: fruit
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:33, Jesus uses the analogy that a tree is known by its fruit to teach that a person's character is revealed by their behavior and outcomes.

questions.question: What practical lesson does Matthew 12 give about generosity and stewardship when Jesus heals the man with a withered hand on the Sabbath?
options: Showing mercy and doing good to others is always right, even if it breaks tradition.
Healing on the Sabbath is forbidden under all circumstances.
Helping others should be postponed to avoid controversy.
Only religious leaders should perform acts of kindness.
questions.correctAnswer: Showing mercy and doing good to others is always right, even if it breaks tradition.
questions.explanation: Jesus heals the man in Matthew 12:13 and teaches that doing good on the Sabbath is lawful, showing the priority of mercy over ritual.

questions.question: How does Matthew 12 illustrate the importance of humility and listening to God's wisdom rather than human pride through the examples of the Queen of the South and the men of Nineveh?
options: Both repented or sought wisdom and will condemn an unrepentant generation.
Pride is rewarded by God.
Only Israelites are accountable to God.
Human wisdom is superior to God's wisdom.
questions.correctAnswer: Both repented or sought wisdom and will condemn an unrepentant generation.
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:41-42 shows that Gentiles who repented or sought wisdom condemn the current generation's unbelief, stressing humility and obedience.

questions.question: According to Matthew 12, how should Christians view opposition and division within their own group when serving Christ?
options: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand, so unity in Christ is essential.
Division is a sign of spiritual success.
Opposition means we should give up.
Only external enemies matter, not internal disputes.
questions.correctAnswer: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand, so unity in Christ is essential.
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in Matthew 12:25-26 that division weakens and destroys, emphasizing the need for unity in God's work.

questions.question: What does Matthew 12 teach about dealing with temptation and spiritual battles through the illustration of binding the strong man?
options: One must first bind the strong man (Satan) to overcome his power.
Temptation should be ignored completely.
Spiritual battles are unnecessary for believers.
Only priests can fight spiritual battles.
questions.correctAnswer: One must first bind the strong man (Satan) to overcome his power.
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:29, Jesus explains the necessity of overcoming Satan's power to spoil his house, symbolizing spiritual victory over evil.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 12 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 12.

questions.question: In Matthew 12:1-8, Jesus defends his disciples' actions on the Sabbath by referencing an Old Testament event involving David. Which Old Testament practice does Jesus cite to justify their actions?
options: David eating the shewbread, which was lawful only for priests
David sacrificing a lamb on the Sabbath
David resting fully on the Sabbath without work
David rebuilding the altar on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: David eating the shewbread, which was lawful only for priests
questions.explanation: Jesus refers to David eating the shewbread, which was not lawful for him or his men except the priests, to illustrate mercy over sacrifice (Matthew 12:3-4, 7).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe his authority over the Sabbath in Matthew 12:8?
options: The Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day
The Sabbath is made for man, not man for the Sabbath
The priests are the keepers of the Sabbath law
The Sabbath should be strictly observed as commanded
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day
questions.explanation: Jesus asserts his lordship over the Sabbath, indicating his authority to interpret its observance (Matthew 12:8).

questions.question: What is the primary reason Jesus gives for healing on the Sabbath in Matthew 12:11-12?
options: Doing good and saving life is lawful on the Sabbath
Healing should only occur during the week
The Sabbath is only for rest, not for work
Healing was forbidden on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Doing good and saving life is lawful on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Jesus compares rescuing a sheep on the Sabbath with healing a man, emphasizing that doing good is lawful on the Sabbath (Matthew 12:11-12).

questions.question: In Matthew 12:17-21, a prophecy from Isaiah is quoted describing Jesus' character. Which of the following is NOT part of that prophecy?
options: He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets
A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench
He will overthrow the kingdoms of the earth by force
In his name shall the Gentiles trust
questions.correctAnswer: He will overthrow the kingdoms of the earth by force
questions.explanation: The prophecy emphasizes gentleness and judgment to victory, not violent overthrow (Matthew 12:19-21).

questions.question: What accusation do the Pharisees make against Jesus after he heals a demon-possessed man in Matthew 12:24?
options: He casts out devils by Beelzebub, the prince of the devils
He performs miracles by sorcery
He breaks the Sabbath law deliberately
He claims to be the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: He casts out devils by Beelzebub, the prince of the devils
questions.explanation: The Pharisees accuse Jesus of casting out demons by the power of Beelzebub (Matthew 12:24).

questions.question: Jesus uses a logical argument to refute the Pharisees’ claim that He casts out demons by Beelzebub. What is the essence of His argument in Matthew 12:25-26?
options: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand
The Pharisees have misunderstood the law
Only priests can cast out demons
He performs miracles only on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand
questions.explanation: Jesus argues that Satan would not cast out Satan because that would divide his kingdom, which cannot stand (Matthew 12:25-26).

questions.question: According to Matthew 12:31-32, which sin is described as unforgivable?
options: Blasphemy against the Holy Ghost
Murder
Idolatry
Blasphemy against the Son of Man
questions.correctAnswer: Blasphemy against the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Jesus states that all sins and blasphemies can be forgiven except blasphemy against the Holy Ghost (Matthew 12:31-32).

questions.question: In Matthew 12:33-35, Jesus uses the metaphor of a tree and its fruit. What does this metaphor primarily illustrate?
options: A person's words reflect the condition of their heart
Trees should be judged by their leaves
Fruitfulness is irrelevant to spiritual life
Only priests produce good fruit
questions.correctAnswer: A person's words reflect the condition of their heart
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that good or evil words proceed from the good or evil treasure of the heart, like fruit from a tree (Matthew 12:33-35).

questions.question: What is the significance of 'the sign of the prophet Jonas' mentioned by Jesus in Matthew 12:39-40?
options: It foreshadows Jesus’ resurrection after three days and three nights
It refers to the destruction of Nineveh
It symbolizes the building of the temple
It denotes the giving of the Law on Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows Jesus’ resurrection after three days and three nights
questions.explanation: Jesus compares His time in the heart of the earth to Jonah’s three days in the whale, pointing to His resurrection (Matthew 12:39-40).

questions.question: Who does Jesus say will condemn 'this generation' at the judgment according to Matthew 12:41-42?
options: The men of Nineveh and the queen of the south
Pharisees and Sadducees
The priests and scribes
The disciples and prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The men of Nineveh and the queen of the south
questions.explanation: Jesus states that the men of Nineveh and the queen of the south will rise in judgment and condemn the current generation for their unbelief (Matthew 12:41-42).

questions.question: In Matthew 12:43-45, Jesus describes a parable about an unclean spirit. What warning does this parable primarily convey?
options: A person who is freed from evil but not filled with good becomes worse
Unclean spirits have no power after being cast out
The spirit always returns to bless the man
The parable refers to the judgment of the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: A person who is freed from evil but not filled with good becomes worse
questions.explanation: The parable warns that when the unclean spirit returns and finds the person empty, it brings seven more spirits, making the condition worse (Matthew 12:43-45).

questions.question: True or False: In Matthew 12:46-50, Jesus redefines familial relationships by stating that those who do the will of the Father are His true family.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus declares that whoever does the will of God is His brother, sister, and mother, redefining family based on obedience rather than blood relation (Matthew 12:49-50).

questions.question: What rhetorical device does Jesus employ in Matthew 12:25 when He says, 'Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation'?
options: Chiasmus to emphasize unity
Simile comparing kingdoms to animals
Hyperbole to exaggerate division
Parable illustrating faith
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasmus to emphasize unity
questions.explanation: Jesus uses a chiasm, a literary device with symmetrical structure, to stress that division within causes ruin (Matthew 12:25).

questions.question: In the historical and cultural context of Matthew 12, why was Jesus' healing on the Sabbath particularly provocative to the Pharisees?
options: Because Sabbath laws forbade work, and healing was considered work
Because healing was reserved exclusively for priests
Because the Pharisees did not believe in miracles
Because the Sabbath was only for temple worship
questions.correctAnswer: Because Sabbath laws forbade work, and healing was considered work
questions.explanation: Jewish law restricted work on the Sabbath, and healing was classified as work, making Jesus’ actions a direct challenge to Pharisaic interpretation (Matthew 12:10-14).

questions.question: How does Matthew 12 reflect the theme of Jesus as the fulfillment of Old Testament prophecy?
options: By quoting Isaiah’s prophecy about the servant and emphasizing Jesus’ role
By narrating the Exodus story in Jesus’ ministry
By repeating the Ten Commandments
By referencing King David’s monarchy exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: By quoting Isaiah’s prophecy about the servant and emphasizing Jesus’ role
questions.explanation: Matthew 12 quotes Isaiah 42:1-4 to show Jesus as the chosen servant fulfilling prophecy (Matthew 12:17-21).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 12 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 12 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Matthew 12, what authority does Jesus claim concerning the Sabbath?
options: He is Lord of the Sabbath
He must obey the Pharisees' interpretation
He has no authority over the Sabbath
The Sabbath is abolished
questions.correctAnswer: He is Lord of the Sabbath
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:8, Jesus declares, 'For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day,' affirming His divine authority over the Sabbath. This aligns with Old Testament portrayals of the Messiah having authority over the Law (Isaiah 9:6), Jesus' lordship (John 13:13), and the Sabbath being made for man, not man for the Sabbath (Mark 2:27).

questions.question: What Old Testament example does Jesus use to defend His disciples plucking grain on the Sabbath?
options: David eating the shewbread
Moses striking the rock for water
Elijah calling fire from heaven
Noah entering the ark
questions.correctAnswer: David eating the shewbread
questions.explanation: Jesus refers to David eating the shewbread, which was lawful only for priests, to show that human need can supersede ceremonial law (Matthew 12:3-4). This example illustrates mercy over sacrifice (Hosea 6:6), and the law's purpose to serve human well-being (Exodus 16:4).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the priests’ actions in the temple on the Sabbath?
options: They profane the Sabbath but are blameless
They perfectly observe the Sabbath laws
They break the law and are guilty
They do not work and rest fully
questions.correctAnswer: They profane the Sabbath but are blameless
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:5 states that priests 'profane the sabbath, and are blameless' because their temple duties require work, showing that God's law allows exceptions for acts of service. This highlights the principle that mercy and purpose of the Sabbath outweigh rigid legalism (Exodus 31:13, Leviticus 24:8-9).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He says, 'I will have mercy, and not sacrifice' in Matthew 12?
options: God desires mercy over ritual sacrifice
Sacrifices are no longer needed
Only sacrifices without mercy are valid
Mercy is less important than sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: God desires mercy over ritual sacrifice
questions.explanation: Jesus quotes Hosea 6:6 in Matthew 12:7 to emphasize that God's primary desire is mercy, not mere external ritual. This theme is echoed throughout Scripture (Micah 6:8, Psalm 51:16-17, Isaiah 1:11-17) affirming that true worship involves compassionate obedience rather than empty rituals.

questions.question: What miracle did Jesus perform in the synagogue that provoked the Pharisees' anger?
options: He healed a man with a withered hand
He raised a widow’s son from the dead
He cast out a legion of demons
He fed five thousand people
questions.correctAnswer: He healed a man with a withered hand
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:9-13, Jesus healed a man with a withered hand on the Sabbath, demonstrating His power over sickness and the true meaning of Sabbath rest. This miracle provoked the Pharisees to plot against Him, showing opposition to His messianic mission (Isaiah 53:4, Luke 6:6-11).

questions.question: How does Jesus justify healing on the Sabbath using an analogy involving a sheep?
options: A man would rescue a sheep in a pit even on the Sabbath
Sheep are not subject to Sabbath laws
Healing is less important than animal care
Only priests can heal on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: A man would rescue a sheep in a pit even on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Jesus argues in Matthew 12:11-12 that if a man would rescue a sheep on the Sabbath, how much more is it lawful to do good to a human, underscoring mercy and compassion as the true intent of the Law (Exodus 23:4-5, Hosea 14:9).

questions.question: What prophecy from Isaiah is cited in Matthew 12 to describe Jesus’ character and mission?
options: He shall not strive nor cry, and will bring judgment to the Gentiles
He will be a conquering king on a white horse
He will reign forever with a rod of iron
He will restore the kingdom of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not strive nor cry, and will bring judgment to the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:18-21 quotes Isaiah 42:1-4, portraying Jesus as the chosen servant who is gentle, humble, and brings justice to the nations, fulfilling messianic expectations (Isaiah 11:1-5, 61:1-3).

questions.question: In Matthew 12, what accusation do the Pharisees make regarding Jesus’ ability to cast out demons?
options: He casts out demons by Beelzebub, prince of demons
He uses the power of the Holy Spirit
He performs miracles with God's approval
He deceives people with trickery
questions.correctAnswer: He casts out demons by Beelzebub, prince of demons
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:24, the Pharisees accuse Jesus of using demonic power to cast out demons, reflecting their spiritual blindness and rejection of His divine authority. Jesus refutes this by logical argumentation (Matthew 12:25-28) and indicates His work is by the Spirit of God (Luke 11:14-20).

questions.question: How does Jesus respond to the Pharisees’ claim that He casts out demons by Beelzebub?
options: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand
He agrees and stops casting out demons
He ignores their accusation
He challenges them to prove it
questions.correctAnswer: A kingdom divided against itself cannot stand
questions.explanation: Jesus explains in Matthew 12:25-26 that Satan would not cast out his own demons because it would divide his kingdom, showing the absurdity of their claim and affirming His divine authority over evil (Mark 3:23-27, Luke 11:17-22).

questions.question: What does Jesus teach about blasphemy against the Holy Spirit in Matthew 12?
options: It is an unforgivable sin
It can be forgiven like other sins
It is a lesser sin
It is not mentioned in the chapter
questions.correctAnswer: It is an unforgivable sin
questions.explanation: Jesus warns in Matthew 12:31-32 that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, emphasizing the gravity of rejecting the Spirit’s work and testimony about Christ, consistent with passages such as Mark 3:28-29 and Hebrews 6:4-6.

questions.question: What teaching does Jesus give about the relationship between a tree and its fruit?
options: A tree is known by its fruit, good or corrupt
Fruit is irrelevant to the tree's nature
Good trees produce bad fruit
Only the fruit matters, not the tree
questions.correctAnswer: A tree is known by its fruit, good or corrupt
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:33, Jesus uses the metaphor that the moral character (tree) is revealed by actions (fruit), teaching that authentic faith produces righteousness, consistent with teachings in Luke 6:43-45 and James 2:14-26.

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give about every idle word spoken by men?
options: Every idle word will be accounted for on the day of judgment
Idle words are harmless and forgiven
Only words against the Son of Man matter
Idle words do not affect salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Every idle word will be accounted for on the day of judgment
questions.explanation: Matthew 12:36-37 teaches that all speech matters before God and will be judged, affirming the biblical principle of accountability for words found also in Proverbs 18:21 and James 3:5-12.

questions.question: What sign does Jesus say will be given to the 'evil and adulterous generation' seeking a sign?
options: The sign of the prophet Jonah
A sign from heaven
A sign of fire and brimstone
No sign at all
questions.correctAnswer: The sign of the prophet Jonah
questions.explanation: Jesus declares in Matthew 12:39-40 that the only sign given will be like Jonah’s three days and nights in the belly of the whale, symbolizing His death, burial, and resurrection, fulfilling Old Testament typology (Jonah 1:17, Hosea 6:2).

questions.question: How does Jesus redefine familial relationships in Matthew 12?
options: Those who do the will of God are His true family
Biological family is the only true family
Family ties are irrelevant to salvation
Only apostles are considered His family
questions.correctAnswer: Those who do the will of God are His true family
questions.explanation: In Matthew 12:48-50, Jesus expands the concept of family to include all who obey God’s will, emphasizing spiritual kinship over biological ties, consistent with Mark 3:34-35 and Galatians 6:10.

questions.question: What is the ultimate condition of a man after an unclean spirit leaves, according to Jesus in Matthew 12?
options: He becomes worse off after seven more spirits enter
He is fully restored and healed
He remains neutral and unchanged
He immediately repents and follows God
questions.correctAnswer: He becomes worse off after seven more spirits enter
questions.explanation: Jesus explains in Matthew 12:43-45 that if a person does not fill their life with righteousness after deliverance, worse spiritual bondage can occur, underscoring the need for continual holiness (Ephesians 4:27, 1 Peter 5:8).
